job_title: Child and Family Therapist in Richmond Hill, ON
pros: Great dedicated team Positive culture
cons: Not enough pay Stressful job

pros: Great employee culture learning opportunities measurement-based care Enjoy going to work a hybrid model of service delivery benefits are pretty good one of the few agencies offering birth to age six mental health intervention trauma-informed and trauma-responsive works with high-conflict families Great place to work if you want to be a very good therapist
cons: Salary could be higher - not what private work offers but there is so much more to consider which makes York Hills a good place to work.

review_title: It is a good job to learn and advance your skills
job_title: Child & Family Therapist in Aurora, ON
pros:
Management is effective, nice /friendly group of coworkers. Lots of training and professional development.
Lots of support from management
cons:
The pay is not enough given the case load number and complexity of each case especially in day treatment. No many opportunities for career advancement. There are no positions for social workers to do indirect work such as research, quality improvement, program evaluation and development. No enough data is being  collected to track how we are being effective in the work.
Working in the evenings should be optional no everyone wants to work after 5.

review_title: positive review great place to work
job_title: Child and Family Therapist, RP in Aurora, ON
pros: York Hills is a great place to work. Staff are welcoming and supportive and best of all they are very good at their jobs. The clinical standard is set high and you are encouraged and supported to continue to learn and be the best you can be. I like to go to work each morning. My manager is very approachable and supportive.
cons: workload but it isn't any different than any other place except that this is a place where managers get it.

review_title: Good place to strat your career
job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Richmond Hill, ON
pros: Good culture, very good colleagues
cons: Low salaries, poor management, poor work-life balance

pros: Great Employer. Great Management support.
cons: No Cons for this employer

pros:
Much work has been put into staff and organization to offer competitive wages, benefits and improve staff morale.
- Strong theoretical foundation across all programs
- Fabulous training both internally and externally to ensure staff are well versed in their practice and growing field
- Understanding and caring team members that care about you as a person
cons: Ongoing changes since the amalgamation of two agencies. While joining programs has helped the agency grow, it has been much more difficult to blend the two cultures of sometimes very different agencies. Old historical drama follows interactions of those who want to move past and progress the agency to a new level.

review_title: Not a workplace in which to thrive as a worker
pros: Lots of training opportunities outside of the agency
cons: Toxic environment.  They ask your opinion but have already set their agenda.

pros: it gives you good clinical experience.
cons: Poor supervision practices, lots of agency meetings which takes away from doing paperwork, very high staff turnover, they take a cookie cutter approach and are very rigid in this. extensive paperwork with unrealistic deadlines. The organization needs to work on having their employees feel valued/like they matter - lots of conversations about it but nothing changes.

pros: Lots of support and guidance. Amazing coworkers willing to help. Provides appropriate training. Reimbursement for Mileage. Management and supervisor are supportive.
cons: Salary is very low. No maternity leave top-up. Hard to concentrate to write reports  in an open office space. No wifi. HR department and financial inadequate.

pros: Not much now. Pay is OK and benefits are what keep most of us here.
cons: If your in the "in" crowd your ok if you don't suck up to them you pay heavily with attitude and a very demeaning upper echelon. Unfortunately it was looking positive but it actually got worse. Stay away. Many people are protected and not accountable for their work or efforts.

review_title: Progressive agency, committed to staff and children, youth and families in the community
pros: Agency committed to best practices, training to support staff to implement work. Generous vacation and sick pay. Positive work culture.
cons: Sometimes the varied nature of the work leads to silos.

pros: The benefits are generous and salaries are okay, Very friendly team of staff.Proper work life balance is encouraged.
cons: Work still needs to be done in hiring folks from diverse background.
